Physical Exam: General physical examination including vital signs (blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature)
Justification: To assess overall health and identify any immediate concerns that may contribute to fatigue.

Physical Exam: Head and neck examination (including thyroid palpation)
Justification: To check for any abnormalities in the thyroid gland which could indicate thyroid dysfunction contributing to fatigue.
To evaluate heart function and rule out any cardiovascular issues that may cause fatigue.
To assess lung function and rule out any respiratory issues that could contribute to fatigue.
To check for any abdominal issues that may relate to decreased appetite and weight loss.

Physical Exam: Neurological examination (including assessment of reflexes and motor function)
Justification: To evaluate neurological function and rule out any neurological causes of fatigue.
To check for any signs of systemic illness, such as pallor or rashes, that may indicate underlying conditions.
